ngiemboon: Keleto la záʼ nkÿo puʼ lóŋ pege légwɔ́ gie pege ge gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie é kwǎʼ ńtsẅɛ́ɛ nò nkwɔɔn lepʉ̌. Púʼu la, pi kúʼte wɛ̌ légwɔ́ mboŋó, ḿbɔ́ɔn légíŋ ńzẅíŋ atsɔ́ mmó gíŋ ńdɔgɔ gẅí ńgÿo menkwɔɔn.
en: For freedom, Christ set us free. Stand firm,   then, and don’t submit again to a yoke of slavery.  # 4:21–5:1 Gl 4:22

ngiemboon: Mèŋ Pɔ̂ɔ, tà mèŋ shwóŋo gẅí. Pi lɔɔn ńzɛ́te ngie mé púʼu gẅí, tá pi gwɔ́ pʉ̀a Ssé, mbà mmó gie Keleto la gÿo ńtí twó sí té gíŋe kẅéte gẅí na tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́.
en: Take note! I, Paul, am telling you that if you get yourselves circumcised, Christ will not benefit you at all.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ ge gíŋ gɔɔn na tsɔ́ legʉ̀a á mbwó wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ɔ gẅie à zɛ́te ngie mé púʼu yé, ngie à gẅiin légÿo shúm ntsèm sie lepʉ̌ Mǒonsê ne ńzɛ́te.
en: Again I testify to every man who gets himself circumcised that he is obligated to do the entire law.

ngiemboon: Pi pie pi ne faʼa légÿo shúm sie lepʉ̌ ŋwɛ́ ne ńzɛ́te tá lɔg kuʼ pʉ̀a pie ée mvfò Ssé ńgwɔ́ ndʉŋndʉŋ, pi ee pɛ́ʼɛ̀ ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie pi fǎg nnɛ́ na Keleto. Á gwɔ́ púʼu pi lɔgɔ ésɔ́ɔn nò gie Ssé kɔʼɔ́ lɔg cÿó gʉm gí.
en: You who are trying to be justified by the law are alienated from Christ; you have fallen from grace.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa na peg pie peg záb ntʉ́m na Keleto, peg ne ńjúʼu nò pɔ́ mbwó Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a, á ne ńgÿo peg ne ńzẅíʼte ngie Ssé ge gÿo gÿo peg gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie ée mvfò yé ńgwɔ́ ndʉŋndʉŋ.
en: For we eagerly await   through the Spirit, by faith, the hope  # 5:5 Rm 8:23–25; 1Th 1:3 of righteousness.

ngiemboon: Á nue nyìŋ lɔɔn ńda nnɛ́ na Keleto, mbà mé lépúʼu yé kà lényé té púʼu yé wɔ́ɔ, á té tsɔ́ nò wɔ́. Lezǎb ntʉ́m na Keleto ḿbiŋ ńkwoŋ pʉ̀a mesoŋ zɔɔ nò.
en: For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision nor uncircumcision accomplishes anything; what matters is faith   working through love.  # 5:6 1Co 13:1; Jms 2:18–22

ngiemboon: Pi ka ne ńgee lé mvfò kwàʼ mboŋó, awɔ̌ tɔʼɔ gẅí légíŋ ńjúʼu nò gie áa nénʉ́ ńtÿɔ́gɔ kwò mǒ?
en: You were running well. Who prevented you from obeying the truth?

ngiemboon: Wɛ̌ véle gẅie mé la shwóŋo gẅí tà pi zẅíŋ, à lɔ̌ɔn těen fóo mbwó Ssé gẅie à ne ńtóŋo gẅí wɔ́.
en: This persuasion does not come from the one who calls you.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ḿbɔ́ɔn té poŋ, á kẅɛɛ kwóonte gẅie à ne faʼa leneŋé.
en: A little leaven   leavens the whole batch of dough.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a kě ne ńgÿo n zsé ngie pi te kẅiʼi tsɔ́ mmó na mmó gie n da zíʼi gẅí wɔ́. N gǐŋ ne ńzsé ngie nyìŋ gẅie à ne ḿmaʼa tág tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wɔ̌ wɔ́ɔ, mbà Ssé ge gÿo záʼ ntsaŋ ye.
en: I myself am persuaded in the Lord you will not accept any other view. But whoever it is that is confusing you will pay the penalty.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ̌ pɔ́ɔn, n gwéʼe péʼe ńgíŋe ńne sáʼa ngie pʉ̀a gÿo mé púʼu wɔ́b, mbà pà Yúndà gíŋ ńkʉ́e wɔ́ɔn mélàʼakɔ́? Mbà legwɔ́ gẅie Keleto la kwé na tÿǒnkǐ, à te gíŋ ńgege wɔ́b wɔ́.
en: Now brothers and sisters, if I still preach circumcision, why am I still persecuted? In that case the offense of the cross   has been abolished.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa na pʉ̀a pie é pue gẅí na nò lépúʼu nyìŋ, pɔ́ lɔgɔ nò yɔ́b ńgee mvfò, tà kwàʼ pɔ́b sele shʉ́ʉ twó mbùm yɔ́b.
en: I wish those who are disturbing you might also let themselves be mutilated!

ngiemboon: Mefɛ̌ pɔ́ɔn, á gʉa na pi, mbà Ssé la tóŋo gẅí páʼ pi ge tsẅɛ́ nkwɔɔn lepʉ̌. Táʼ, tà pi zẅɛʼ púʼu, ńgÿo mmó gie mbùm gi zɔ sáʼa gẅí pi gÿo. Tà ńcʉ́ʼ púʼu, pi lɔg páʼ nkwòŋe ee tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi ńkẅéte mennɛ́ mí.
en: For you were called   to be free, brothers and sisters; only don’t use this freedom as an opportunity  # 5:13 Lit a pretext; a military term for abuse of position for the flesh, but serve one another through love.

ngiemboon: Á nue anò gie á pú ńkwɛ́ metwó menò mie ée tsɛ̀ɛ lepʉ̌ gɔɔn ngie: Kwoŋo fɛ̌ gù nyìŋ mesoŋ páʼ twó mbùm jú.
en: For the whole law is fulfilled   in one statement: Love your neighbor as yourself.   # 5:14 Lv 19:18,# 5:14 Lv 19:18; Mt 7:12; 19:19; 22:37–40; Jn 13:34

ngiemboon: Tá ńgwɔ́ gie pi lɔɔn ne ńgÿo páʼ menɔ̀ɔn mbàʼ pie ée ńdúmte membùm mɔ́b, ńnéŋe mefʉ̌ŋ, pi laga twó gí, á nue pi ee púʼu, ńcʉ́ʼʉ faʼa pɔ́ lécʉŋte mennɛ́ mí.
en: But if you bite and devour   one another, watch out, or you will be consumed by one another.

ngiemboon: N ge gɔɔn né pi ngie: Pi zẅíŋ À Zẅìge Ssé zɔ tsyeen gẅí na gẅi legwɔ́, púʼu, pi le gÿo menò tepòŋ mie mbùm gi tsóte gẅí ngie pi gÿo wɔ́.
en: I say, then, walk by the Spirit   and you will certainly not carry out the desire of the flesh.

ngiemboon: Á nue menò mie mbùm nyìŋ mesoŋ tsóte yé ngie à gÿo, é té mie Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a ne ńkwoŋo ngie à gÿo wɔ́. Menò mie Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a ne ńkwoŋo, é té mie mbùm nyìŋ mesoŋ kwoŋ wɔ́, pɔ́ mépʉ́a lɔgɔ ńdʉʼʉ lʉʼʉ. Áa yɛ̌ tá pi te gẅiin légÿo mmó gie pi kwǒŋ wɔ́.
en: For the flesh desires   what is against the Spirit, and the Spirit desires what is against the flesh; these are opposed to each other, so that you don’t do what you want.  # 5:17 Rm 7:15,23; Php 2:13

ngiemboon: Táʼ, pi lɔɔn ńzẅíŋ à Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a ne ńtsyeen gẅí, mbà lepʉ̌ té gíŋ ńgẅiin lésáʼa gẅí wɔ́.
en: But if you are led by the Spirit, you are not under the law.

ngiemboon: Mé ne ńkwaʼa ńzsé menò mie mbùm nnɛ́ nyìŋ mesoŋ tsóte yé á fʉa, á nò páʼ letǒŋ panzwě kà léfaʼ mbàŋa wɔ́ɔ, á nò páʼ legÿo menò ncÿǒ, á nò páʼ nyìŋ letÿɔ́g ntʉ́m wé pɔ́ na nò mpfwɔ̀ʼ.
en: Now the works of the flesh are obvious:   sexual immorality,  # 5:19 Mk 7:21; 1Th 4:3 moral impurity,  # 5:19 1Th 4:7 promiscuity,  # 5:19 Mk 7:22

ngiemboon: Páʼ leguʼte shúm ńdɔg ńgÿo Ssé, páʼ legẅiin lekàŋ, páʼ lekuɔ mbù, páʼ ndʉʼʉ́ ndʉʼʉ́, páʼ legẅiin kegɔ̀ʼ, páʼ lecÿɔ́g, páʼ lefaʼ pɔ́ létyé mvfò na kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ, páʼ leneŋé fagte fagte, páʼ letuŋ metuŋ.
en: idolatry,   sorcery,  # 5:20 Rv 18:23 hatreds,  # 5:20 Rm 8:7 strife,  # 5:20 Ti 3:9 jealousy,  # 5:20 Jms 3:4 outbursts of anger,  # 5:20 Rv 14:19 selfish ambitions,  # 5:20 Rm 2:8 dissensions,  # 5:20 Rm 16:17 factions,  # 5:20 2Pt 2:1

ngiemboon: Páʼ letÿɔ̌g lejÿɔ́g na shúm pʉ̀a, páʼ lenǔ melùʼ tà ḿbʉ́a, páʼ lecuʼté na línɔ̀ɔn lépfɛ́ shúm ńgÿo menò shʉ́, mbɔɔ páʼ legÿo tsɔ́ shúm sie é sẅé sie mé tʉ̌ lɔɔn. N ka zɔɔn shwóŋo gẅí, n ge gíŋ shwóŋo gẅí ngie: Epʉ̀a pie é gÿo yɔɔn ntí menò té láʼ gẅiin jʉʼ na nò lefùɔ Ssé wɔ́.
en: envy,  ,# 5:21 Rm 1:29 drunkenness, carousing,  # 5:21 Rm 13:13; 1Pt 4:3 and anything similar. I am warning you about these things #— #as I warned you before #— #that those who practice such things will not inherit the kingdom of God.  # 5:21 1Co 6:10; 15:50

ngiemboon: Táʼ, menò mbòŋo mie Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a gÿo nyìŋ gÿo, é mɔɔn ńgwɔ́ légẅiin nkwòŋe, ńgwɔ́ lénéŋe né lekág, ńgwɔ́ lénéŋe lé sẅétè, ńgwɔ́ légẅiin kwɔ̀gɔnnɛ́, ńgwɔ́ létyé lékẅéte pʉ̀a, ńgwɔ́ légẅiin pòŋontʉ́m, ńgwɔ́ lénéŋe té gwɔ́ ngàŋ mepàb,
en: But the fruit of the Spirit   is love,  # 5:22 1Co 13:1; Phm 5 joy,  # 5:22 Jn 15:11; 2Co 6:10 peace, patience,  # 5:22 Ex 34:6; 2Tm 3:10 kindness,  # 5:22 Ps 25:6; 2Co 6:6 goodness, faithfulness,

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ lépʉ́le, ńgwɔ́ lékúʼte mbùm. Áa kwàʼ nénʉ́, lepʉ̌ té lʉʼ sɔɔn shúm wɔ́.
en: gentleness,   and self-control.  # 5:23 2Pt 1:6 The law is not against such things.  # 5:23 Or Against such things there is no law

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pie ée pe Yěsô Keleto leen ńgwáʼ shúm tepòŋ sie é póŋ mbùm nnɛ́ yɔb, lâ sie mbùm nnɛ́ ŋwɛ́ zɔ tsɔ̌ɔn, tà á gwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ fʉ̀ʼ gie pɔ́ leen ńkim mbùm nnɛ́ ŋwɛ́ na tÿǒnkǐ la.
en: Now those who belong to Christ Jesus   have crucified the flesh  # 5:24 Rm 8:12 with its passions and desires.  # 5:24 2Pt 1:4; 2:10

ngiemboon: Páʼ wege legwɔ́ we fʉ̀ʼɔɔn fóo pɔ́ mbwó Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a la, pege giŋe na ntí gie Zẅìge ŋwɛ́ ne ńnyɛɛ wégè.
en: If we live   by the Spirit, let us also keep in step with the Spirit.

ngiemboon: Tà pege ŋáʼte nnɛ́, tà pege tág melàʼ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pege, tà pege gẅiin kegɔ̀ʼ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pege.
en: Let us not become conceited, provoking one another, envying one another.
